results.title: They called it 'fire proof'
results.creator_credit: Roger Blais and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: It was considered a fireproof hospital, yet fire did break out. The building was modern in construction; reasonable safety precautions were observed; but all this proved insufficient. The film argues the case for safety-consciousness and constant vigilance by the entire staff of any institutional building.

results.title: They appreciate you more
results.creator_credit: Kathleen Shannon and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Aliette lives in Montreal with her husband and three children. Since both Aliette and Pierre work outside their home full-time, they share household responsibilities. This development has changed them as individuals and, they think, has affected the dynamics of their family - for the better. This film is interesting for mixed audiences of women and men.

results.title: They all can work
results.creator_credit: Brian Pollard, Rex Tasker and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Natural Recovery Systems of Moncton, New Brunswick, is a recycling factory. The employees are efficient and conscientious. All are eligible for on-the-job training and an after-hours life-skills program. They are mentally and physically disabled, a resource of forgotten people. The film shows them on and off the job, learning new skills, and generally relaxing among themselves in the company cafeteria. Narrated by Joseph Rutten. (Award: New York.)

results.title: These were the days: Victoria revisited
results.creator_credit: David Morgan and Kestrel Film Productions
results.brief_description: Takes the audience around Victoria to see the preserving of history in country towns. The port of Echuca where the paddle streamer Canberra runs up the Murray River; Sovereign Hill in Ballarat; Burke Museum at Beechworth; The Museum of Agricultural Machinery at Warracknabeal; The Gippsland Folk Museum at Moe; Coal Creek mining town at Korumburra and the Pioneer Settlement.

results.title: These three
results.creator_credit: William Wyler, Samuel Goldwyn and Samuel Goldwyn Company
results.brief_description: This cinematic masterpiece, directed with enormous sensitivity by William Wyler, tells the story of two women (Merle Oberon and Miriam Hopkins) who fall in love with the same man (Joel McCrea) and the damage to their lives that can be caused to all three by the malicious lies of a spiteful teenage schoolgirl (Bonita Granville). This powerful story of gossip and suspicion was based on Lillian Hellman’s controversial Broadway success “The Children’s Hour.” The appearance of Walter Brennan as the local taxi driver brings the only light relief to such a dramatic film and the outstanding performance of Bonita Granville was nominated for an Academy Award.
results.creator_credit_for_label: William Wyler, Samuel Goldwyn and Samuel Goldwyn Company

This powerful story of gossip and suspicion was based on Lillian Hellman’s controversial Broadway success “The Children’s Hour.” The appearance of Walter Brennan as the local taxi driver brings the only light relief to such a dramatic film and the outstanding performance of Bonita Granville was nominated for an Academy Award.

results.title: These things I still question
results.creator_credit: Ken Saunders, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Ken Saunders questions the things in his life that he didn’t understand, like why his dad was treated differently, why he couldn’t play with the white kids and why people just let this happen.

results.title: These are scouts
results.brief_description: Shows what it means to be a scout in 1971 and gives details of how a local Scout Group is run. Included are many of the Movement’s activities such as camping, gliding, boating, caving, and overseas travel.

results.title: Thermometers: how they help us
results.brief_description:
Demonstrates the basic principle that liquids expand when heated and contract when cooled. Shows how a thermometer is built and used and depicts different types of thermometers.
Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.
